subSubSection.paragraph: Stenosagola newtoni can only be recognised by the aedeagus (Fig. 1, Fig. 2). The shape of the median lobe is diagnostic. It is broad and flattened, with a slender apical lobe. The apical lobe is usually curved to the left in dorsal view (Fig. 1). The apical lobe is closer to the right hand margin of the main body of the median lobe than it is to the left hand margin. The left hand margin is more convex (in the apical half) than the right hand margin.
